events.message: On January 14th, I was involved in a collision where my car was rear-ended at a stoplight, causing significant damage to the rear bumper and trunk.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and accident details provided by the policyholder.
A dedicated insurance agent has been assigned to handle this case and will coordinate all further communications and investigations.
The insurance company has formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and is preparing the necessary steps to process it efficiently.
To proceed, please submit copies of the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and your driver's license for verification purposes.
The customer has successfully submitted all requested documents, including the police report, pictures of the damaged car, and personal ID.
An investigation team has begun analyzing the submitted materials and inspecting the vehicle to assess the extent of the damage.
The investigation report is complete, confirming the damage aligns with the reported rear collision and no policy exclusions apply.
A settlement proposal has been prepared offering full coverage for the repair costs, including parts and labor as per the policy terms.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement proposal and is looking forward to timely repairs and service.
The claim has been formally approved by the claims department with authorization for immediate payment and vehicle repair.
Payment has been issued to the repair shop, enabling the customer to proceed with necessary vehicle restoration work without delay.
Following completion of repairs and confirmation of payment, the insurance claim has been officially closed and all records updated.
The complete file of the auto accident claim has now been archived electronically for future reference and compliance purposes.
